(now also available in English) Speech Yves Mersch:  The European banking union – first steps on a long march
 http://t.co/M5jpT17iBw
Draghi: We need to harness the market mechanism in the service of humanity
Draghi: We should build a strong and deep economic and political union in Europe, to the benefit of all members of the single currency.
Draghi: Our common currency exists not as an end, but as a means: to foster peace between nations and to further our collective prosperity.
Draghi: These reforms should aim not only to create more growth and jobs, but also to make society fairer.
Draghi: We need reforms that make doing business easier, ensure that those who owe taxes actually pay taxes.
Draghi: Economic adjustment is coming at a heavy social cost. We are fully aware of the human dimension.
Draghi: We cannot repair unsound budgets, clean up struggling banks, solve deep-rooted problems in the structure of Europe’s economies
Draghi: We do not act to help banks or governments. We act to help maintain the flow of credit to real firms and households.
Draghi: Fears in the sovereign bond market were unjustified by economic fundamentals. They were the result of market failure.
Draghi: A currency whose integrity is in doubt cannot be a stable currency
Draghi: Preserving price stability today requires different actions than it did in the past
